content: Muhammad Umair Hassan is a master degree student at University of Jinan, China. He completed his bachelor in computer science from the University of the Punjab, Pakistan. He is working as a research assistant in Shandong Provincial Key Laboratory of Network Based Intelligent Computing, University of Jinan, China. His research interests include Machine Learning, Computer Vision, Deep Learning, and Image Retrieval. He has previously worked in Computer Networking, Cloud Computing and Natural Language Processing.
summary: Muhammad Umair Hassan is a master degree student at University of Jinan, China. He completed his bachelor in computer science from the University of the Punjab, Pakistan. title: Muhammad Umair Hassan

content: Click the Cite button above to demo the feature to enable visitors to import publication metadata into their reference management software.    Click the Slides button above to demo Academic’s Markdown slides feature.   Supplementary notes can be added here, including code and math.
summary: This work proposes a pipeline for image retrieval task performed on Oxford5k and Paris6k datasets. First, we used CNN-based feature extraction and then parallelly we used SIFT-based feature extraction for the same query image. At CNN level we used R-MAC detection followed by sum-pooling, and then we calculated the similarity score using L2 distance. T-embedding and democratic aggregation followed the SIFT and similarity score calculated further added with a CNN-based similarity score, and we applied query expansion to check the accuracy of the proposed pipeline comparing it with other state-of-the-art methods. The newly added annotations and original annotations were used and set as testbeds for the comparisons and found that image retrieval is still a challenging problem for new upcoming retrieval tasks.
title: A framework for the revision of large-scale image retrieval benchmarks
